intro: Elcismia coriacea, commonly known as the roughleaf elcismia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves that are covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. Elcismia coriacea produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
